title: SAP Stock Is Up After It Pre-Announced Strong Earnings and Named an American co-CEO
text:
SAP (SAP) shares are trading higher after the German enterprise software giant pre-announced better-than-expected third quarter results—a surprising result that comes amid widespread hand-wringing about slowing enterprise software spending. The company also disclosed that CEO Bill McDermott is stepping down, with longtime SAP board members Jennifer Morgan and Christian Klein taking over as co-CEOs, in a move consistent with the company’s longstanding succession plan.

Morgan’s appointment makers her one of the few women with...
description: SAP shares are trading higher after pre-announcing better-than-expected third quarter results, a result that comes amid widespread hand-wringing about slowing enterprise software spending. The company also disclosed that CEO Bill McDermott is stepping down, with longtime SAP board members Jennifer Morgan and Christian Klein taking over as co-CEOs.
